page.title: 06Norton Nurseries
page.content: { Norton Nurseries are in Letchworth on Norton Road. It is about 70 years old. Carl Keeble runs it on his own but at weekends his brother and his father help. His father also makes the lovely wooden bird-tables and plant containers which they sell. The rarest plant they have got is the miniature water lily; the most common is the lobelia. They have approximatately 500 different types of plants for sale. The tallest plant is the pine which grows to about 13 metres. You walk round the nurseries on gravel paths. There are several wooden bridges over little streams. The large greenhouse is also landscaped with a stream running through and pretty rustic bridges.
